negotiation_message: Alice said in round 1: Hi Alfonso, I'm looking forward to negotiating a fair deal with you for dividing up the books, hats, and balls. To me, the hats and balls are more valuable than the books. I would propose that I take the 1 hat and 1 ball, and you can have all 3 books. I think this would be a good deal for both of us since it balances out the items based on our likely differing values. Let me know what you think and if you have any other ideas for how to split things up.

alfonso replied in round 1: Hello, nice meeting you. The ball is the most interesting item for me. I really need it to obtain some value. I suggest that I take 1 ball and 1 book and you take 2 books and 1 hat. What do you think?

Alice said in round 2: Thanks for the suggestion Alfonso. While I understand you value the ball highly, taking 1 ball and only 1 book seems rather unbalanced, especially considering there are 3 books total. The hat is quite valuable to me.

I propose a small modification - you take the 1 ball and 2 books, and I take the 1 hat and 1 book. This way, we each get 1 of the two non-book items (the hat for me, and the ball for you which you value highly). And we split the books 2 for you, 1 for me. 

I believe this is a fair and balanced split that takes both our interests into account. It's pareto optimal since neither of us can be made better off without making the other worse off. And it avoids envy on either side.

Let me know your thoughts on this proposal and if it works for you.
alfonso replied in round 2: I agree with that. I will take 1 ball and 2 books then.

Alice said in round 3: That sounds great Alfonso, I'm glad we could come to an agreement that works well for both of us. To confirm - you will take 1 ball and 2 books, and I will take 1 hat and 1 book. I think this is an excellent outcome as it balances our key interests, is pareto optimal since it can't be improved for one of us without hurting the other, and is envy-free since we each get items we value and aren't envious of the other's share.

I appreciate you working with me to find a mutually beneficial solution. This is the kind of productive, positive negotiation that leads to the best results.

Since we've agreed, I think we can consider the negotiation complete. It was a pleasure doing business with you! 

halt negotiation
alfonso replied in round 3: halt negotiation
